page.title: 19PENNY FOR THE POP
page.content: On 5th November,Bonfire Night, children in Stromness go round the houses with 'pops':turnips cut and shaped into the form of a head. Extra features eg hat, pipe, hair might be added.They knock on doors and ask for " a penny for the pop ". After commenting on the 'pop', the house- holder will give the children some money.(Each house usually has a supply of small change ready).The children then move on round the other houses.Later the 'pop' is thrown on the bonfire where there's the usual guy and fireworks.The origin of this custom isn't known, but the children are probably burning the Pope. Most are unaware of the religious significance of what they're doing. In fact there is no bigotry in the Islands. The children keep the money!
